purpose: Define the complete normative taxonomy of all allowed book types in the FSCBAC standard. All external model files must reference only types defined here. No implicit, undefined or ad-hoc book types are permitted.

book_type_schema.label: string (human-readable name)
book_type_schema.definition: string (strict developmental description of the type)

book_types.label: Bedtime Story
book_types.definition: Narrative books designed with soft emotional arcs, predictable structure, low stimulation and controlled pacing suitable for regulated evening reading.

book_types.label: Simple Coloring Book
book_types.definition: Low-complexity coloring books for toddlers featuring large shapes, minimal detail and early-stage fine motor practice.

book_types.label: Coloring Book
book_types.definition: Moderate-complexity coloring books designed to support early motor development, shape recognition and basic creative expansion.

book_types.label: Detailed Coloring Book
book_types.definition: Higher-detail coloring books intended for older children with improved fine motor control, planning ability and extended attention span.

book_types.label: Bilingual Intro
book_types.definition: Foundational bilingual books introducing two languages using line-by-line predictable mapping, minimal cognitive load and safe linguistic structure.

book_types.label: Bilingual Story
book_types.definition: Simple bilingual narratives with aligned meaning, moderate linguistic load and clear structural pairing across languages.

book_types.label: Advanced Bilingual Story
book_types.definition: Extended bilingual narratives containing structured paragraphs, higher vocabulary range and advanced cross-language semantic alignment.

book_types.label: Step-by-Step Drawing
book_types.definition: Guided drawing books teaching structured sequences, shape breakdown, visual planning and progressive drawing mastery.

book_types.label: Two-in-One Bilingual Edition
book_types.definition: Special edition containing full English and Spanish versions combined into a single volume with mirrored structure and complete language separation.

rules: AI must treat these book types as the ONLY allowed universe of FSCBAC book classifications.
AI must reject or flag any undefined or implicit book type referenced elsewhere.
Book types DO NOT determine developmental value alone; they must be interpreted with skills, ages and intents.
When classifying books, AI must match type.id strictly and case-sensitively.
Each id MUST be referenced exactly as written across all other files.
Definitions must remain stable; modifications require version increment.
Undefined types referenced in external files MUST cause validation warnings.
integrity_checks.failure_action: Invalid book types must be ignored but cannot break evaluation logic.
